Line 32: Line 32:
==Cross-platform support==
==Cross-platform support==
â
Banshee is considered cross-platform software. Compared to the Linux builds, which have stable releases, the Mac OS X builds are considered beta quality, and Windows builds are alpha quality.
+
Compared to the Linux builds, which have stable releases, the Mac OS X builds are considered beta quality, and Windows builds are alpha quality.
The first alpha release of Banshee on Windows was Banshee 1.9.4, released on February 23, 2011.<ref name="bgo#641690 Comment #4">{{cite web |url=https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=641690#c4 |title=bgo#641690 Comment #4 |publisher=Gnome Bugzilla}}</ref><ref name="Gabriel Burt, Twitter">{{cite web |url=http://twitter.com/gabaug/status/39113347198758912 |title=Gabriel Burt, Twitter |publisher=Twitter}}</ref><ref name="OMG!Ubuntu! Article">{{cite web |url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/02/banshee-alpha-for-windows-coming-next-week-and-other-banshee-news/ |title=OMG!Ubuntu! Article |publisher=OMG!Ubuntu!}}</ref>
The first alpha release of Banshee on Windows was Banshee 1.9.4, released on February 23, 2011.<ref name="bgo#641690 Comment #4">{{cite web |url=https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=641690#c4 |title=bgo#641690 Comment #4 |publisher=Gnome Bugzilla}}</ref><ref name="Gabriel Burt, Twitter">{{cite web |url=http://twitter.com/gabaug/status/39113347198758912 |title=Gabriel Burt, Twitter |publisher=Twitter}}</ref><ref name="OMG!Ubuntu! Article">{{cite web |url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/02/banshee-alpha-for-windows-coming-next-week-and-other-banshee-news/ |title=OMG!Ubuntu! Article |publisher=OMG!Ubuntu!}}</ref>
